document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Limaytilla Casal, 1964 (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) from Argentina, a key for the known species, and new record data for the Argentinian species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Limaytilla Casal, 1964 (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) from Argentina, a key for the known species, and new record data for the Argentinian species

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Male. Specimens relatively small to medium and slender ( 5–10 mm long and 1.1–1.8 mm wide) (Figs 7, 8); triangular head, outline of posterior margin of the head strongly convex with rounded contours in dorsal view (see Fig. 3 in Casal, 1964 ); mandible with almost parallel margins from the base to the apex, with poorly differentiated teeth, basal ventral tooth simple (see Fig. 3 in Casal, 1964 ); antennal tubercles with inner subtriangular and dor-

Studied material.

, A. Ibarra Grasso ( 1 male , IFML )
.
